channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous trees and wall, 15th February
item.description:
Reported couple of years ago and nothing done! These trees are well over grown. They are also leaning and damaging the wall which is unsafe to the public. There is a risk of these trees falling into the road. If you investigate you’ll see the state of the house and gardens so nothing will get done. Needs urgent endorsement enforcement action for safety Please check records as reported before

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Common, Bromley Common, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Underpass between Sandcliff Road and West Street blocked, 15th February
item.description:
Very large puddle and drain blocked meaning that underpass is not accessible. Not even possible to walk around on grass as very muddy.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandcliff Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drove onto the sidewalk and parked there, 15th February

Drove onto the sidewalk and parked there... dangerous driving etc.

item.title: The light in the car park does not work., 15th February
item.description:
The light in the car park has been broken for months. this car park is extremely dark in the evenings. This car park is directly behind number 2 Red Barracks Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Frances Street, Woolwich

item.title: Blocked drains and wet leaves and bush cuttings, 15th February
item.description:
Two drains are blocked in this car[park which is causing serious flooding. this has been reported numerous times to the highways and the contact centre. With no avail. Bushes and trees have been cut down around the car park and NOT cleared away properly which is causing the paths and road to be extremely slippy and is a serious hazard. residents have already slipped and hurt themselves. This car park is directly behind houses 2, 4, 6 & 8 Red Barracks Road. has been an issue for over 2 months.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Red Barracks Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains blocked on the turning circle, 15th February
item.description:
We are continually getting flooding across the pavements as the drains are completely blocked and water isn’t draining away. Further down the road outside number loads of mud is being washed down where vans are driven across the grass verge. This mud then washes down the drains and blocks them. This has been going on for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Shuttle Close, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole 50x70 and 10cm deep, and growing, 15th February
item.description:
This has been growing daily for the last few weeks. Stones are thrown up as each car passes which can injure people and damage cars

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dukes Avenue, Church End, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping all down Rollins street, 15th February
item.description:
There is a large amount of flight tipped waste both of grocery like household rubbish and also I’ve dumped furniture at the end of Ron Street towards the railway bridge it has been here for a significant length of time and the issue appears getting worse with recent additions of multiple pieces of furniture such as a couch taken apart IKEA furniture and also construction waste from what seems to be a car repair business being operated on the street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rollins Street, New Cross Gate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders waste obstructing pavement, 15th February
item.description:
For a week now the neighbours next door have left their waste on the street which is Completely obstructing the pavement - not accessible for wheelchairs at all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Oxonian Street, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling at the door entrance of Regents Court, 15th February
item.description:
A dog owner in the building is consistently failing to clean up after their pet. The waste is left behind, resulting in residents stepping in it and spreading it into the building. I have now witnessed this happening on three occasions
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 15th February
item.description:
I previously reports this blocked drain and I got a notice it was resolved but nobody has been to clear it and been consistently blocked. Report ref: 8649523 This drain blocks the entire side of the street flow of water. This cause if all to run on the surface and go down the only open drain on around the corner which gets overwhelmed as the pictures show. The reported location is the blocked drain. Not the one on the corner. I believe when they resurfaced the street some gravel and other debris from the work had made its way down into the drain.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Corbylands Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
